document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the cleptoparasitic bee genus Epiclopus Spinola, 1851 (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Ericrocidini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the cleptoparasitic bee genus Epiclopus Spinola, 1851 (Hymenoptera: Apidae: Ericrocidini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. During the preparation of this publication, I visited the collection of the Colegio San Pedro Nolasco, Santiago , Chile ( CSPN ) to photograph the holotype of
Mesonychium wagenknechti
. According to J. Salamanca, the curator of the collection, the holotype had unfortunately been destroyed. In this paper a neotype for this species is designated and described, along with the description of the unknown female.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 28–31.
Epiclopus wagenknechti
. Fig. 28. Female (Chile: El Tofo): Head, frontal view (scale bar 1 mm). Fig. 29. Female: Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 5 mm). Fig. 30. Neotype male (Chile: Castilla): Head, frontal view (scale bar 1 mm). Fig. 31. Neotype male: Habitus, lateral view (scale bar 5 mm).

FIGURES 32–35.
Epiclopus wagenknechti
, male genitalia (Chile: Travesía). Fig. 32. Genital capsule: dorsal view. Fig. 33. Genital capsule: ventral view. Fig. 34. S7: dorsal view. Fig. 35. S8: dorsal view (scale bars 0.5 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male ( CSPN , destroyed). Neotype male here designated with the following information: Chile , III Región Atacama Castilla
13 -02- 1972
M. Pino Colector [white label]\ Neotype
Mesonychium wagenknechti
Ruiz, 1938
F. Vivallo
des., 2014 [red label]. The neotype will be deposited at MHNS .

Original type locality.
Chile : IV Coquimbo Region: Los Chiches.
Neotype locality.
Chile : III Atacama Region: Castilla.

Host.
Centris ( Wagenknechtia ) rhodophthalma
( Wagenknecht, 1969 , 1971 ;
Rocha-Filho et al ., 2009
†).
Centris ( Penthemisia ) chilensis
(
Wagenknecht, 1969
;
Vivallo et al ., 2003
;
Rocha-Filho et al ., 2009
†).
